metadata.Title: CVE-2016-20013 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - negligible
metadata.Description: sha256crypt and sha512crypt through 0.6 allow attackers to cause a denialof service (CPU consumption) because the algorithm's runtime isproportional to the square of the length of the password.

criterions.comment: syslinux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
syslinux-legacy: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was deferred').
sssd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
zabbix: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
